nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error.
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation: Constructor function
nodes.name: TokenERC20

nodes.documentation: @dev Fix for the ERC20 short address attack.
nodes.name: onlyPayloadSize

nodes.documentation: Internal transfer, only can be called by this contract
nodes.name: _transfer

nodes.documentation:
Transfer tokens
     * Send `_value` tokens to `_to` from your account
     * @param _to The address of the recipient
@param _value the amount to send
nodes.name: transfer
transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
Set allowance for other address
     * Allows `_spender` to spend no more than `_value` tokens in your behalf
     * @param _spender The address authorized to spend
@param _value the max amount they can spend
nodes.name: approve
approveAndCall
transferForMultiAddresses

nodes.documentation:
Destroy tokens
     * Remove `_value` tokens from the system irreversibly
     * @param _value the amount of money to burn
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation:
Destroy tokens from other account
     * Remove `_value` tokens from the system irreversibly on behalf of `_from`.
     * @param _from the address of the sender
@param _value the amount of money to burn
nodes.name: burnFrom

nodes.documentation:
approve should be called when allowances[_spender] == 0. To increment
allowances value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until
the first transaction is mined)
From MonolithDAO Token.sol
nodes.name: increaseApproval
